Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band cup; interior glazed black; exterior: handle zone frieze with confronted animals (on the left a feline, chest and forelegs remaining; of a ram to right part of head, forelegs and chest remain); glazed below with reserved band on lower wall.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 128, pl. XXXIX, no. 357.5)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 39, pl. 109, no. 8)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 234, no. 199)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1372) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4772 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
